Journal of Fish Diseases https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/ This is an open access article under the terms of the http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/ ABSTRACT The parasite Enteromyxum leei  E. leei  Paralichthys olivaceus  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei emaciation disease Enteromyxum leei myxosporean Paralichthys olivaceus toltrazuril National Research Foundation of Korea 10.13039/501100003725 pmc-status-qastatus 0 pmc-status-live yes pmc-status-embargo no pmc-status-released yes pmc-prop-open-access yes pmc-prop-olf no pmc-prop-manuscript no pmc-prop-legally-suppressed no pmc-prop-has-pdf yes pmc-prop-has-supplement no pmc-prop-pdf-only no pmc-prop-suppress-copyright no pmc-prop-is-real-version no pmc-prop-is-scanned-article no pmc-prop-preprint no pmc-prop-in-epmc yes source-schema-version-number 2.0 cover-date November 2025 details-of-publishers-convertor Converter:WILEY_ML3GV2_TO_JATSPMC version:6.6.4 mode:remove_FC converted:02.10.2025  Funding: 1 Introduction  Enteromyxum  E. leei E. scophthalmi E. fugu E. caesio  Takifugu rubripes  Pagrus major  Oplegnathus punctatus  Scophthalmus maximus  Paralichthys olivaceus 2020 2002 2021 2002 2004 2008 Parvicapsula anisocaudata  E. leei 2015 2016 2001 2012 In 2023, Jeju Island contributed 49.1% of Korea's total olive flounder production, yielding approximately 22,493 tonnes of the national total of 45,801 tonnes (KOSIS, 2023 2019 2018 However, the prevention and control of myxosporean infections is complicated by the lack of effective treatments and poor understanding of various aspects of the transmission and life cycle of these parasites, particularly in marine species. Chemotherapy for myxosporosis is not well‐established; however, agents such as fumagillin and toltrazuril (a symmetric triazinone) have been reported as effective drugs for the treatment of several myxosporosis infections (Kang et al. 2020 1993 1990 2009 2011 1995 1988 2019 K a The antiparasitic effects of toltrazuril have also been demonstrated in vivo against Henneguya Myxobolus Myxobolus Henneguya 1991 Myxobolus 1989 E. scophthalmi 2006  E. leei 2020 In this study, we investigate the cytotoxicity and antiparasitic effects of toltrazuril against  E. leei 2020 2009  E. leei  E. leei 2 Material and Methods 2.1 Cell Viability Assay to Determine Safe Concentrations of Toltrazuril Three toltrazuril‐based products used to treat coccidiosis (named A, B and C for the purpose of this study; for product compositions, see Table 1 4 ( cell viability % = experimental group absorbance − blank absorbance / control group absorbance − blank absorbance × 100 ) . TABLE 1 Composition of toltrazuril‐containing products used in the experiment. Test formulation Ingredient Content (1 L) Product A Toltrazuril 50 g Sodium propionate 1.8 g Sodium benzoate 1.8 g Sodium docusate Suitable amount Simethicone Suitable amount Bentonite Suitable amount Citric acid hydrate Suitable amount Xanthan gum Suitable amount Propylene glycol Suitable amount Purified water Suitable amount Product B Toltrazuril 50 g Sodium docusate 2.5 g Sodium propionate 1.8 g Sodium benzoate 1.8 g Simethicone 0.5 g Citric acid 4 g Product C Toltrazuril 25 g Triethanolamine 300 g Polyethylene glycol Suitable amount 2.2 Method for Isolating  E. leei To isolate  E. leei g 2.3 Viability Analysis Using HO PI HO & PI double staining was performed for viability analysis. Specifically, 150 μL of NucBlue Live ReadyProbes Reagent (Hoechst 33342) and 1 μg/mL of PI (eBioscience) were added to the centrifuged intestinal fluid pellet described in Section 2.2 2.4  DNA For DNA isolation, 50 mg of dissected intestinal tissue was used. DNA was isolated using a DNeasy Blood & Tissue Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to the manufacturer's instructions. The isolated DNA was stored at −80°C until further analysis. 2.5 Polymerase Chain Reaction Analysis Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplification was conducted in 20 μL of reaction mixture, which contained the DNA extracted from olive flounder intestinal tissue, 0.5 μM of each primer (Table 2 TABLE 2 Primer set used in this study. Targeting Primer name Oligonucleotide sequences (5′‐3′) Expected size (bp) References   E. leei EL‐1F CTA TTC GAT GGT ATA CAT AG 1338 Lee et al. ( 2024 (18 s rDNA) EL‐1R GTC TAC TCT TTC GAG CAA AC 2.6 In Vitro Assay An in vitro assay was conducted to evaluate the direct effect of toltrazuril on  E. leei  E. leei 2.2  E. leei 1 FIGURE 1 Schematic representation of the  E. leei 2.7 Effect of Toltrazuril on  E. leei Experiment 1 was conducted to evaluate the efficacy of toltrazuril in damaging or killing  E. leei  E. leei 2.8 Effect of Toltrazuril on  E. leei Experiment 2 aimed to evaluate the efficacy of toltrazuril in killing  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei 2.9 Effect of Toltrazuril on Mortality of Infected Olive Flounders and Analysis of Histopathological Changes: Experiment 3 Experiment 3 was performed to investigate whether feeding toltrazuril could reduce mortality and histopathological changes in olive flounders affected by emaciation disease. On January 1, 2023, 20 olive flounders exhibiting severe signs of emaciation (average weight 358 ± 104 g; average length 34.15 ± 2.57 cm) were transported to the laboratory from Jeju olive flounder farm. The fish were acclimated in a 150‐L tank for 1 day, with the water temperature maintained at 20°C ± 1°C. Following acclimation, 10 fish were orally administered toltrazuril at a dose of 10 mg/kg body weight for 5 days, while the other 10 fish received five‐day oral administration of PBS as a control. The mortality rate was monitored over a period of 19 days. After the experiment, all surviving individuals were humanely killed using MS‐222. The intestines of the sacrificed olive flounders were dissected for DNA extraction and viability staining of  E. leei 2.10 Statistical Analysis The results of the cell viability assay to determine safe concentrations of toltrazuril were expressed as mean ± standard deviation (SD) values from at least three independent experiments. Statistical analyses were performed using a one‐way analysis of variance (ANOVA) followed by Tukey's post hoc test in Jamovi (Version 2.3.28). A p 3 Results 3.1 Safe Concentration of Toltrazuril Determined by Cell Viability Assay HINAE cells treated with 10, 20, 30, 40, 50, 100, 200 and 400 μg/mL of Product A exhibited cell viability percentages of 104.82% ± 2.81%, 96.92% ± 5.97%, 95.84% ± 9.86%, 95.94% ± 8.12%, 88.84% ± 6.02%, 77.45% ± 3.03%, 67.78% ± 3.21% and 51.24% ± 6.747%, respectively (Figure 2 2 2 FIGURE 2 Cell viability percentage of Hirame natural embryo cells treated with varying concentrations of toltrazuril (Products A–C). Viability was assessed using the CCK‐8 assay. * p p p 3.2 In Vitro Effect of Toltrazuril on  E. leei Fish with PCR‐confirmed  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei 3 3D 3 FIGURE 3 Hoechst33342 and propidium iodide (HO & PI) double staining of the vegetative stage of  E. leei 3.3 Toltrazuril Kills  E. leei In Experiment 1, five olive flounders with  E. leei 4  E. leei FIGURE 4 Infected olive flounders were orally administered toltrazuil (20 mg/kg) for 5 days. HO & PI double staining of VSE isolated from the intestines of olive flounder on the third day (A) and fifth day (B) of toltrazuril administration. HO & PI staining was observed using a laser scanning confocal microscope (scale bar = 10 μm). 3.4 Toltrazuril Mixed Feed Kills  E. leei In Experiment 2, morphological analysis of the parasites isolated from the fish confirmed that the observed spores were exclusively VSE. HO & PI double staining of  E. leei 5B 5C 5 6 FIGURE 5 Infected olive flounders were provided toltrazuril mixed feed for 5 days at a dose of 20 mg/kg. HO & PI double staining of VSE isolated from the intestines of olive flounder on the fifth day (A) and eighth day (B) after feeding with toltrazuril (20 mg/kg) for 5 days. (C) Olive flounder before feeding with toltrazuril. HO & PI staining was observed using a laser scanning confocal microscope (scale bar = 10 μm). FIGURE 6 Cumulative mortality (%) in olive flounder infected with  E. leei 3.5 Effect of Toltrazuril (10 mg/kg) on  E. leei In Experiment 3, olive flounders with  E. leei 7  E. leei  E. leei 8  E. leei 8C–D FIGURE 7 HO & PI double staining of VSE isolated from the intestines of olive flounder at 14 days after administration of toltrazuril (10 mg/kg) (A) or PBS (B) for 5 days. HO & PI staining was observed using a laser scanning confocal microscope (scale bar = 10 μm). FIGURE 8 Histopathology of olive flounder infected by  E. leei 4 Discussion Cytotoxicity analysis via the CCK‐8 assay confirmed that toltrazuril Product A was safe at a concentration of 50 μg/mL, as well as at concentrations between 40 and 100 μg/mL, which are previously reported cytotoxic concentrations of toltrazuril (da Silva et al. 2017 2023 Subsequent experiments were therefore conducted at safe concentrations of 20 and 10 mg/kg body weight of toltrazuril. The toltrazuril concentrations used in this study were selected based on previous findings that reported no behavioural or histological side effects in fish (Bermúdez et al. 2006 E. scophthalmi 2006 1989 1991 1990 Hoferellus carassii  Carassius auratus Therefore, to investigate the effect of toltrazuril on  E. leei  E. leei K. septempunctata 2009 2016  E. leei 3 4 5 7  E. leei Myxobolus Henneguya 1989 1991  E. leei 4 In Experiment 2, when toltrazuril was administered for 5 days,  E. leei 5B 5C  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei 6  E. leei  E. leei Schmahl et al. ( 1989 1991 Henneguya Myxobolus  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei An earlier study also reported that  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei 2002  E. leei 2006  E. leei 2020  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei In conclusion, we evaluated the cytotoxicity and efficacy of toltrazuril in the treatment of infections caused by the myxosporean parasite  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei  E. leei Author Contributions  Young Juhn Lee: Yeong Eun Oh: Eung Jun Lee: Lyu Jin Jun: Joon Bum Jeong: Conflicts of Interest The authors declare no conflicts of interest.
